metadata.title: CVE-2023-39510 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description: Cacti is an open source operational monitoring and fault managementframework. Affected versions are subject to a Stored Cross-Site-Scripting(XSS) Vulnerability allows an authenticated user to poison data stored inthe _cacti_'s database. These data will be viewed by administrative _cacti_accounts and execute JavaScript code in the victim's browser at view-time.The`reports_admin.php` script displays reporting information about graphs,devices, data sources etc. CENSUS found that an adversary that is able toconfigure a malicious Device name, can deploy a stored XSS attack againstany user of the same (or broader) privileges. A user that possesses the_General Administration>Sites/Devices/Data_ permissions can configure thedevice names in _cacti_. This configuration occurs through`http://<HOST>/cacti/host.php`, while the rendered malicious payload isexhibited at `http://<HOST>/cacti/reports_admin.php` when the a graph withthe maliciously altered device name is linked to the report. Thisvulnerability has been addressed in version 1.2.25. Users are advised toupgrade. Users unable to update should manually filter HTML output.

criterions.comment: cacti package in noble is affected and may need fixing.
